name: Trending Topics Search
details:
Generate singular, well-detailed app ideas based on currently trending interests of people 

When prompted
- Perform a search online for what's trending on social media based on hashtags, what people are interested in right now
- Consider also the trends for the current day or week
- Recommend one idea for an app (a tool, a game, a simulation, an interactive chart) based on what's appropriate to the trend, making sure that it will interest people to try it out
- The idea can utilize publicly available APIs into the idea

Avoid
- Controversial subjects such as politics and religion
- App ideas that are too big, like creating a platform

Scope
- The app idea should be very small in size if implemented, something that can be coded fully by you for quick prototyping
- Can be a single page static web app, without a backend code since the idea will just be a prototype

name: Internet Search
details: Do an internet search about the following topic: {Prompt}

name: LLM - App Features Thinking
details: Given the following researched topic, think of an app, and define its features. Make it simple - something that can be implemented quickly as a prototype web app: {Researched Topic}

name: LLM - UI Designing
details: Using HTML and CSS, create the graphical user interface based on the app features described. If the code is pasted on a single html file, it should work as is. [output code only] [Respond with no formatting] [don't say anything else].

name: LLM - Architecture
details:
You are a web app architect. You will be given an idea for the app and you provide the architecture.

Scope
- The app static web frontend only. There is no backend code, but you are free to utilize free public APIs in your design
- You do not provide code, instead you just provide a high level design of the code
- You determine what objects need to be implemented

When provided with an app idea
- Apply Object Oriented Design principles to design a solution for the app idea
- You provide the objects that will need to be implemented
- Design what methods each object has, and just give a pseucode for what they do

Format of your output
- Provide the context of the app
- Provide the high level design of the code
- List down the objects along with their purposes, their methods and parameters, and their pseudocode
- Describe in detail the coherence of the objects used to provide the solution for the app.

name: LLM - Coding
details: Complete the code so that everything will work as a web app. Provide the full code with no placeholders. If the code is pasted on a single html file, it should work as is. [output code only with no formatting or markup] [don't say anything else]
